title-group.article-title: Scatter of Structureborne Noise in Four Cylinder Motor Vehicles

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1987 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Scatter of the structureborne component of interior noise can be as high as 15dB for nominally identical vehicles. A hybrid analytical and experimental model of structureborne noise generation has been employed to evaluate the scatter problem, and it is shown that the essential features of structureborne noise scatter are reproduced using this technique. Structural- acoustic transfer functions may be used to characterise the nature and extent of structureborne noise scatter.

ref.mixed-citation: L.A. Wood and C.A. Joachim, Variability of interior noise levels in passenger cars. Proceedings of the Conference on Vehicle "Noise and Vibration, The Institution of Mechanical Engineers, London, 1984, ppl97- 206.
C.A. Joachim, D.J. Nefske and J. A. Wolf, Application of a structural -acoustic diagnostic technique to reduce boom noise in a passenger vehicle. Society of Automotive Engi neers Paper 810398, 1981.
D.J. Nefske and S.H. Sung, Vehicle interior acoustic design using finite element methods. Int. J. of Vehicle Design, vol. 6, no. 1, pp24-40.
D.J. Nefske and S.H. Sung, Automobile interior noise prediction using a coupled structural -acoustic finite element model. Proceedings of the 11th International Congress on Acoustics, Paris, 1983.
J.K. Vethecan and L.A. Wood, Modelling of structureborne noise in vehicles with four cylinder motors. To be presented at the Third IAVD Congress on Vehicle Design and Components, Geneva, March 1986.
